About the Brand:
Everything created at the House of Pataudi is inspired by the modern Indian sensibility. We believe in a seamless weave of the past with the present. Our carefully crafted pieces give expression to a refined and effortless way of life.

About the collection:
Rozana: Everyday wear with a contemporary ethnic touch. Easy, contemporary silhouettes with a hint of detailing to transcend your daily wardrobe essentials. The collection celebrates a mix of prints and solids with attention to details inspired from the regal architecture of the Palace.

Short description:
Special Technique/Craft:
The Bagru Folk Project goes hyper local in 2021 by putting a spotlight on the vitality of animals in rural lifestyles and economy and eulogising Amba, the elephant from Kerala. The prints of this line are also influenced by the countless works of art that line the mud walls of our artisans' homes, painted by the womenfolk of the household, taking the form of guileless folk prints in cooling neutrals and pastels for a bright, lively winter casual wardrobe.

Product Name: Men Off-White & Blue Indigo Printed Pure Cotton Casual Shirt With Pocket Detail
Short description:
Special Technique/Craft:
Since Indus Valley civilisation era, Indigo's imperial acceptance has made it a craft in itself whether used in Tie-and-Dye, Shibori or Block prints. The vibrant deep-blue dye is extracted from the plant family, Indigofera tinctoria. It is the oldest natural dye known to mankind. It can be used to dye any kind of natural fiber universally.

Design:
Region: Rajasthan
Off-white and blue ethnic motifs printed casual shirt
Has a mandarin collar
Button placket
1 patch pocket
Long roll-up sleeves
Curved hem
Technique: Indigo
Disclaimer:
This is a handcrafted kurta, and is prone to colour bleeding due to use of natural dyes
The print on the garment might be uneven owning to the handcrafted nature of the product, adding essence to the garment.
Taavi uses sustainable thread for the manufacturing of its garments.

Moisture Absorbent - It absorbs twice as much moisture as cotton, making it the "Most Thirsty Fabric."
UV Protection - Hangup fabric  protects the skin from harmful UV rays 
Natural Breathing - Hangup fabric is comfortable and easy, Insulating in winter and breathable in summer.

Inimitable Feel - The true feel of  can never be replicated
Meticulous Weave - The Quality and detailing in the weave of fabric is the product .

For A Lifetime- Hangup buy from Indian mail and make sure every wash keep the same finish

About the Brand
BGN APPARELS, formed in the year 1980, is the brainchild of Shri Satish Gupta and family. Hangup deals in menswear which is currently being marketed in some major cities of India and aboard. It features a collection that embodies the beauty of handcrafted embroideries and fabrics. This label brings together couture sensibilities and timeless style.

Product Name: Men White And Yellow Block Print Legacy Pure Cotton Casual Shirt
Short description:
Special Technique/Craft:
Block printing is a process of using wooden blocks to create impressions on a cloth. The main tools of the printer are wooden blocks in different shapes - square, rectangle, oval, round and semi-circular or crescent - and sizes called bunta. Blocks are hand-carved of seasoned teak wood by trained craftsmen. The blocks for imprinting are hand-carved by skilled artisans in wood. These hand-carved blocks are used to imprint the design onto the fabric. The imprinting is done by hand by a skilled block printer.

Design:
Region: Andhra Pradesh, Gujarat, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, West Bengal
White and Yellow
Block printed shirt with button placket
Spread collar
Short, regular sleeves
One patch pocket
Curved hemline
Block print legacy
Disclaimer:
This is a handcrafted shirt and is prone to colour bleeding due to the usage of natural dyes
The print on the garment might be uneven- owing to the handcrafted nature of the product, adding essence to the garment.

About the Brand
BGN APPARELS, formed in the year 1980, is the brainchild of Shri Satish Gupta and family. Hangup deals in menswear which is currently being marketed in some major cities of India and aboard. It features a collection that embodies the beauty of handcrafted embroideries and fabrics. This label brings together couture sensibilities and timeless style.

Features:
Moisture Absorbent - It absorbs twice as much moisture as cotton, making it the "Most Thirsty Fabric."
UV Protection - Hangup fabric  protects the skin from harmful UV rays 
Natural Breathing - Hangup fabric is comfortable and easy, Insulating in winter and breathable in summer.
Anti-Bacterial - Hangup uses peach finish to make fabric soft to use and makes it "Health Fabric", Anti-bacterial.
Meticulous Weave - Quality and detailing in the weave of fabric is the product .
Sheer vibrancy - Over 20,000 high quality designs of patterns and textures to choose from.
For A Lifetime- Hangup buys from indian mail and make sure every wash keep the same finish

Product Name: Men Cream-Coloured & Brown Bagru Printed Pure Cotton Casual Shirt With Pocket Detail
Short description:
Special Technique/Craft:
Bagru: Bagru a small town situated south-west of Jaipur, is famous for its traditional hand block printed fabrics. Motifs are transferred onto light coloured background with wooden blocks following two techniques - direct and resist. Bagru motifs are mostly derived from the flora and fauna and are natural in origin.

Design:
Region: Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh
Cream-coloured and brown ethnic motifs printed casual shirt
Has a spread collar
Button placket
1 patch pocket
Short regular sleeves
Curved hem
Disclaimer:
This is a handcrafted kurta, and is prone to colour bleeding due to use of natural dyes
The print on the garment might be uneven owning to the handcrafted nature of the product, adding essence to the garment.
Taavi uses sustainable thread for the manufacturing of its garments.

Product Name: Men Kalamkari Print Pure Cotton Sustainable Casual Shirt with Chest Pocket
Short description:
Special Technique/Craft:
Kalamkari is a type of hand-painted or block-printed cotton textile, wherein motifs are inspired by the folklore and are hand-painted using the tool of kalam directly onto the fabric. The process involves washing, rinsing, soaking and bleaching the fabric and applying mordants and dyes using natural substances like indigo (blue), madder (red), mango bark (yellow) and palm sugar (black). Painting on the fabric is done with a kalam, charcoal and myrobalan paste.

Design:
Region: Andhra Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh
Peach, maroon & olive green coloured casual shirt 
Ethnic motifs printed
Has a spread collar
Button placket
1 patch pocket
Short roll-up sleeves
Curved hem
Craft: Kalamkari 
Disclaimer:
This is a handcrafted kurta is prone to colour bleeding due to the use of natural dyes
 The print on the garment might be uneven owing to the handcrafted nature of the product, adding essence to the garment.
Taavi uses sustainable thread for the manufacturing of its garments.

Since Indus Valley civilisation era, Indigo's imperial acceptance has made it a craft in itself whether used in Tie-and-Dye, Shibori or Block prints. The vibrant deep-blue dye is extracted from the plant family, Indigofera tinctoria. It is the oldest natural dye known to mankind. It can be used to dye any kind of natural fiber universally.

Product Design Details:
Beige, Green & Blue Opaque Casual shirt
Floral Printed
Spread Collar
Button Placket
1 Patch Pocket
Short Regular Sleeves
Curved Hem
Craft: Indigo
Disclaimer:
This is a handcrafted shirt and is prone to colour bleeding due to the use of natural dyes
 The print on the garment might be uneven owing to the handcrafted nature of the product, adding essence to the garment.
Taavi uses sustainable thread for the manufacturing of its garments.

Product Name: Men Purple & White Printed Bagru Folk Pure Cotton Casual Shirt
Short description:
PRODUCT DETAILS 
Special Technique/Craft:
The Bagru Folk Project goes hyper local in 2021 by putting a spotlight on the vitality of animals in rural lifestyles and economy and eulogising Amba, the elephant from Kerala. The prints of this line are also influenced by the countless works of art that line the mud walls of our artisans' homes, painted by the womenfolk of the household, taking the form of guileless folk prints in cooling neutrals and pastels for a bright, lively winter casual wardrobe.

Design
Purple and White shirt for men
Ethnic motifs printed
Spread collar
Button placket
Short, regular sleeves
Curved hem
Craft- Bagru Folk
Disclaimer:
This is a handcrafted kurta, and is prone to colour bleeding due to use of natural dyes
The print on the garment might be uneven owning to the handcrafted nature of the product, adding essence to the garment.
Taavi uses sustainable thread for the manufacturing of its garments.
Taavi uses sustainable thread for the manufacturing of its garments.
